channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Council vans parking wherever they want, 18th November
item.description:
Council vans regularly park in positions on Reading Lane which are marked as no parking and no waiting or loading - I have just received a ticket for parking here despite paying for on-street parking. I never have space on the road due to council vans.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Florfield Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very bad road conditions specially for bicycle riders., 18th November
item.description:
I have been commuting via Shooters Hill Road for almost 5 years now, and all the roads are good (fixed, repaired and some are newly done) but only this part of the road out side Shooters Hill Children's Centre - 398 Shooters Hill Rd, London SE18 4LP and around all the signal crossings is so bad that my bicycles either breakdown or gets puncture the moment I cross this road and only this part of the road is not repaired or fixed since i have been using this road. Kindly request to repair this road please.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wricklemarsh Road, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are many flags illegally flying from the street lights, 18th November
item.description:
A large number of flags have been added to the light posts in and around this location and the a127 junction. As well as being illegal to add these flags they are also dangerous and a distraction to drivers on what is a fast section of A road. It is only a matter of time before they cause a collision due to distraction or from blocking street lighting.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southend Arterial Road, London Borough of Havering
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Continuing misuse of commercial waste bins, 18th November
item.description:
These bins are constantly overflowing with non-commercial waste, the business fails to maintain them or use them properly. The bins are being used by passesby and litter is often overflowing onto the street, it is unsightly and unhygienic. Whilst the bins are occasional emptied by the councils operatives they are soon full again. It is promoting an unpleasant aspect of an already troubled alley, often used as an open air urinal. No the bins provide perfect cover for this! The bins themselves are also making the pavement too narrow for wheelchair users and pedestrians need to walk into the road to pass them , especially when they are overflowing with waste. I have already reported this issue and received no follow up, the council site reports this case as closed. It is far from closed for us local residents who find it quite distressing. Please attend to this issue, a review should be conducted into if this at all an appropriate location for commercial bins of this size.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Crucifix Lane, The Borough, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weekly street cleaning - Findon Road, Edmonton, 18th November
item.description:
Findon Road , Edmonton both sides have not been swept for 3 weeks and has been missed each Wednesday , lots of litter and wet leaves all along on the pavement and road. Please can we get street cleaning team to sweep the road. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): South Road, Edmonton, Enfield, London Borough of Enfield
Report on FixMyStreet
